statement.title: Content
statement.content:
Can you calculate how many sequence $a_1, a_2, ..., a_k$ satisfied that gcd($a_1, a_2, ..., a_k$) = $d$ and lcm($a_1, a_2, ..., a_k$) = $n$. All $a_i$ ($1 \leq i \leq k$) are positive integers.

gcd is the greatest common divisor and lcm is the least common multiple.

Two sequences $A$ and $B$ are different if there is at least one $i$ ($1 \leq i \leq k$) that $A_i \neq B_i $.

statement.title: Standard Input
statement.content: There is only one line contains three integers $k$ ($2 \leq k \leq 10^9$), $d$ ($1 \leq d \leq 10^9$), $n$ ($1 \leq n \leq 10^9$).

statement.title: Standard Output
statement.content: Output one line with the answer mod $10^9+7$.

statement.title: Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
2 1 64
